datasetParam.name: ds_gene_ids
datasetParam.help: input a comma delimited set of gene ids, or upload a file

stringParam.name: signature
stringParam.help: Used to pass the Users Signature to the component sites

stringParam.name: depended_value
stringParam.help: Used to pass the value of a depended param into the query for a dependent flat vocab param.

enumParam.name: best_alignment_only
enumParam.help: Select yes to return only those EST alignments that are the best alignment for the EST. Many of the ESTs align at multiple positions in the genome. Selecting yes will consider only those alignments that are the best for each EST

stringParam.name: max_number_best_alignments
stringParam.help: EST sequences can have two (or more) best alignments that have the same percent identity, length and score. This parameter allows you to specify the maximum number of these best alignments that will be considered for any EST to be included in the query. For example, if you specify 1 then all the ESTs that do not have a unique best alignment will be ignored in the query.

enumParam.name: high_confidence_only
enumParam.help: Select yes to return only those EST alignments that are consistent. We define define consistent as having >= 95% identity (the majority have >= 99%) and aligning the EST sequence in a manner that is consistent with a gene model. Ie, there can be gaps (representing introns) in the target genomic sequence but not in the EST query.

stringParam.name: min_percent_identity
stringParam.help: You can specify a minimum percent identity of the alignment between the EST and genomic DNA. We only store alignments with >= 90% identity

stringParam.name: min_percent_est_aligned
stringParam.help: Enter the minimum percentage of bases in the EST sequence that are aligned to genomic DNA in this alignment.

stringParam.name: bp_overlap_gte
stringParam.help: Overlap of expressed sequence tag (EST) alignments with annotated genes is a useful approach to verify gene predictions. In general, the specificity of this evidence is proportional to the overlap length.

stringParam.name: stoxopforganism
stringParam.help: You can select one or more organisms by checking the box next to the one(s) that you wish to use.

enumParam.name: BlastAlgorithm
enumParam.help: The Blast Program that will be executed: blastp compares an aminoacid query sequence against a protein sequence database; blastn compares a nucleotide query sequence against a nucleotide sequence database; blastx compares the six-frame conceptual translation products of a nucleotide query sequence (both strands) against a protein sequence database; tblastn compares a protein query sequence against a nucleotide sequence database dynamically translated in all six reading frames (both strands); tblastx compares the six-frame translations of a nucleotide query sequence against the six-frame translations of a nucleotide sequence database.

enumParam.name: BlastDatabaseType
enumParam.help: Select the data type that you want to blast against.

stringParam.name: BlastQuerySequence
stringParam.help: BLAST Input Sequence (upto 2MB)

enumParam.name: -filter
enumParam.help: Set the low complexity filter. WUBLAST's default behavior is not to use this filter. NCBIBLAST's is to use it. When filter is set to 'yes' WUBLAST uses seg; NCBIBLAST uses dust for blastn, seg otherwise.

stringParam.name: -e
stringParam.help: Expected number of hits with at least this score. The lower the e- value the more significant the hit.

stringParam.name: -v
stringParam.help: Number of one-line descriptions to show

stringParam.name: -b
stringParam.help: Number of alignments to show

flatVocabParam.name: chromosomeOptional
flatVocabParam.help:
Select chromosome. NOTE: Not all organisms have the same number of chromosomes.
T. brucei:11
L. braziliensis:35
L. infantum:36
L. major:36
T. cruzi:41

stringParam.name: sequenceId
stringParam.help: Enter an identifier for a genomic sequence. The IDs correspond to the accession numbers in the GenBank records supplied by the sequencing centers. Wild cards are permitted in most queries, i.e. use AAEE* to ask for all C.parvum contigs. Genes By Chromosomal Location does not allow wildcards.

Enter an identifier for a genomic sequence. The IDs correspond to the accession numbers in the GenBank records supplied by the sequencing centers. Wild cards are permitted in most queries, i.e. use LbrM01* to ask for all contigs that have identifiers that begin with DS11. Genes By Chromosomal Location does not allow wildcards.

Enter an identifier for a genomic sequence. The IDs correspond to the accession numbers in the GenBank records supplied by the sequencing centers. Wild cards are permitted in most queries, i.e. use DS11* to ask for all contigs that have identifiers that begin with DS11. Genes By Chromosomal Location does not allow wildcards.

Enter an identifier for a genomic sequence. The IDs correspond to the accession numbers in the GenBank records supplied by the sequencing centers. Wild cards are permitted in most queries, i.e. use AACB0200* to ask for all contigs/scaffolds that have identifiers that begin with AACB0200. Genes By Chromosomal Location does not allow wildcards.

Enter an identifier for a genomic contig. The IDs correspond to the accession numbers in the GenBank records supplied by the sequencing centers. Contig ID's from C. parvum whole genome sequencing project begin with 'AAEE' and contig ID's for C. hominis begin with 'AAEL'. The C. parvum Chromosome 6 independently sequenced at MRC-LMB before the whole genome project was completed is 'BX526834 '. Wild cards are permitted in most queries, i.e. use AAEE* to ask for all C. parvum contigs. Genes By Chromosomal Location does not allow wildcards.

Sequence IDs for P. falciparum chromosomes are 'Pf3D7_01' through 'Pf3D7_14.' Sequence IDs for P. yoelii contigs begin with 'MALPY'. Sequence IDs for P. vivax contigs begin with 'ctg_'. P. berghei sequences start with PB, P. chabaudi sequences start with PC, and P.knowlesi sequences start with PKH. Wild cards are permitted in most queries, i.e. use MALPY* to ask for all P. yoelii sequences. Genes By Chromosomal Location does not allow wildcards.

stringParam.name: start_point
stringParam.help: Select the distance (in nucleotides) to the start

stringParam.name: end_point
stringParam.help: Select the nucleotide you would like to end in. Note that 0 equals the end so you can get genes right up to the end of the sequence. The default settings start = 1 and end = 0 will give you results from the entire sequence.

enumParam.name: snp_strain_a
enumParam.help: Choose a reference from the list of strains. Strains are sorted by number of SNPs in descending order.

flatVocabParam.name: snp_strain_b
flatVocabParam.help: Choose a comparator from the list to compare to your reference. Strains below the ---------- were sequenced at low or specific coverage

enumParam.name: snp_strain_b
enumParam.help: Choose a comparator from the list to compare to your reference.

enumValue.term: RH (type I; chr IA and IB only)

enumParam.name: snp_strain_m
enumParam.help: Choose a comparator(s) from the list to compare to your reference. Strains are ordered by number of SNPs in descending order.

stringParam.name: motif_expression
stringParam.help: Enter a Perl regular expression describing the desired motif. Example: 'CC6+RK' searches for two consecutive cysteine residues followed by a stretch of hydrophobic amino acids followed by the aminoacids arginine and lysine.

stringParam.name: min_ests_in_assembly
stringParam.help: Enter a minimum number of ESTs that is required per EST assembly.

stringParam.name: min_lib_ests_in_assembly
stringParam.help: Enter a minimum number of ESTs from the selected libraries that is required per EST assembly.

stringParam.name: min_seq_coverage
stringParam.help: Use this parameter to set a minimum amount of (amino acid) sequence coverage for the mass spec-predicted peptides. For example, setting this parameter to 10 will return only those genes whose proteins are at least 10% covered by mass spec.-predicted peptides. In the current dataset the average percent coverage is about 9%, and the maximum is about 90%. Note that even if this parameter is set to 0%, only genes with at least some mass spec. predictions for the specified stage will be returned. In other words, it never returns proteins with 0% coverage, only those with strictly > 0%.

stringParam.name: min_span_count
stringParam.help: Use this parameter to set a minimum for the number of nonoverlapping regions (spans) that must be found in the mass spec. data for a gene (and the specified lifecycle stage). Only genes with at least this many spans are returned

stringParam.name: min_sequence_count
stringParam.help: Use this parameter to set a minimum for the number of unique peptide sequences found that must match a gene in order for it to be returned by the query. Roughly speaking this parameter provides a measure of the abundance of the protein product in question, at least within a particular experiment.

stringParam.name: min_spectrum_count
stringParam.help: Use this parameter to set a minimum for the number of mass spectra found that must match a gene in order for it to be returned by the query. Roughly speaking this parameter provides a measure of the abundance of the protein product in question, at least within a particular experiment.

answerParam.name: isolateHistoryIdA
answerParam.prompt: Isolate History ID for Set A
answerParam.help: The number in the left column of My Query History

answerParam.name: isolateHistoryIdB
answerParam.prompt: Isolate History ID for Set B
answerParam.help: The number in the left column of My Query History

enumParam.name: chromosome_with_organelles
enumParam.help: Results will be sorted ascending or descending orde

stringParam.name: text_expression
stringParam.help: Enter text you would like to search for. Multiple words may be entered, for example: membrane receptor signal inner.

timestampParam.name: timestamp
timestampParam.help: A new value will be generated automatically every time when user runs/reruns a query from question page

stringParam.name: genes_ids
stringParam.help: Gene IDs (locus tags) are quite different for each species. We use the gene IDs provided by the sequence generator.

suggest.sample: AAEL010000057, AAEE01000009, BX526834, Pf3D7_04, MALPY00019, TGME49_chrVIIa, TGGT1_chrX

sqlQuery.name: TrypChromosome
sqlQuery.sql: select * from ( select distinct chromosome as term, chromosome_order_num as internal from apidb.SEQUENCEATTRIBUTES sa,sres.taxon tn where sa.ncbi_tax_id = tn.ncbi_tax_id and tn.taxon_id in ($$depended_value$$) and chromosome is not null union select 'Choose chromosome' as term,0 as internal from dual) order by internal asc

sqlQuery.name: TrypChromosomePortal
sqlQuery.sql: select * from ( select distinct chromosome as term, chromosome_order_num as internal from apidb.SEQUENCEATTRIBUTES where organism = 'Trypanosoma cruzi strain CL Brener' and chromosome is not null union select 'Choose chromosome' as term,0 as internal from dual) order by internal asc

sqlQuery.name: SnpStrainA
sqlQuery.sql: select distinct strain_a as internal, CASE WHEN strain_a = 'Preich' THEN 'P. reichenowi (vs. 3D7 only)' ELSE 'Pf-' || strain_a END as term, 1 as ord from apidb.snpsummary where strain_a in ('3D7', 'Dd2', 'GHANA1', 'HB3', 'IT', '7G8', 'D10') union select distinct strain_b as internal, CASE WHEN strain_b = 'Preich' THEN 'P. reichenowi (vs. 3D7 only)' ELSE 'Pf-' || strain_b END as term, 1 as ord from apidb.snpsummary where strain_b in ('3D7', 'Dd2', 'GHANA1', 'HB3', 'IT', '7G8', 'D10') union select distinct strain_a as internal, CASE WHEN strain_a = 'Preich' THEN 'P. reichenowi (vs. 3D7 only)' ELSE 'Pf-' || strain_a END as term, 3 as ord from apidb.snpsummary where strain_a not in ('3D7', 'Dd2', 'GHANA1', 'HB3', 'IT', '7G8', 'D10', 'Preich') and strain_a not like '%-NIH' union select distinct strain_b as internal, CASE WHEN strain_b = 'Preich' THEN 'P. reichenowi (vs. 3D7 only)' ELSE 'Pf-' || strain_b END as term, 3 as ord from apidb.snpsummary where strain_b not in ('3D7', 'Dd2', 'GHANA1', 'HB3', 'IT', '7G8', 'D10', 'Preich') and strain_b not like '%-NIH' union select 'foobar' as internal, '-----------' as term, 2 as ord from dual order by ord,internal

sqlQuery.name: SnpStrainB
sqlQuery.sql: select distinct strain_a as internal, CASE WHEN strain_a = 'Preich' THEN 'P. reichenowi (vs. 3D7 only)' ELSE 'Pf-' || strain_a END as term, 1 as ord from apidb.snpsummary where strain_a in ('Preich', 'Dd2', 'GHANA1', 'HB3', 'IT', '7G8', 'D10','D6','FCC-2','K1','RO-33','SANTALUCIA','Senegal3404','V1_S' ) union select distinct strain_b as internal, CASE WHEN strain_b = 'Preich' THEN 'P. reichenowi (vs. 3D7 only)' ELSE 'Pf-' || strain_b END as term, 1 as ord from apidb.snpsummary where strain_b in ('Preich', 'Dd2', 'GHANA1', 'HB3', 'IT', '7G8', 'D10','D6','FCC-2','K1','RO-33','SANTALUCIA','Senegal3404','V1_S') union select distinct strain_a as internal, CASE WHEN strain_a = 'Preich' THEN 'P. reichenowi (vs. 3D7 only)' ELSE 'Pf-' || strain_a END as term, 3 as ord from apidb.snpsummary where strain_a not in ('3D7', 'Dd2', 'GHANA1', 'HB3', 'IT', '7G8', 'D10', 'Preich','D6','FCC-2','K1','RO-33','SANTALUCIA','Senegal3404','V1_S') and strain_a not like '%-NIH' union select distinct strain_b as internal, CASE WHEN strain_b = 'Preich' THEN 'P. reichenowi (vs. 3D7 only)' ELSE 'Pf-' || strain_b END as term, 3 as ord from apidb.snpsummary where strain_b not in ('3D7', 'Dd2', 'GHANA1', 'HB3', 'IT', '7G8', 'D10', 'Preich','D6','FCC-2','K1','RO-33','SANTALUCIA','Senegal3404','V1_S') and strain_b not like '%-NIH' union select 'foobar' as internal, '-----------' as term, 2 as ord from dual order by ord,internal

sqlQuery.name: EstLibraries
sqlQuery.sql: select distinct REGEXP_SUBSTR(ORGANISM,'[[:alpha:]]+[[:space:]]+[[:alpha:]]+') as term, 0 as internal, '' as parentTerm from Apidb.ESTATTRIBUTES where PROJECT_ID = '@PROJECT_ID@' union select distinct CASE WHEN att.stage != 'unknown' and att.DBEST_NAME not like '%'||att.stage||'%' THEN REPLACE(att.dbest_name, ',', ';') || ' (' || REPLACE(att.stage, ',', ';') || ')' ELSE REPLACE(att.dbest_name, ',', ';') END AS term, att.library_id as internal, REGEXP_SUBSTR(att.ORGANISM,'[[:alpha:]]+[[:space:]]+[[:alpha:]]+') as parentTerm from apidb.ESTATTRIBUTES att where att.PROJECT_ID = '@PROJECT_ID@'

sqlQuery.name: EstLibrariesGenes
sqlQuery.sql: select distinct t.* from (select distinct REGEXP_SUBSTR(ORGANISM,'[[:alpha:]]+[[:space:]]+[[:alpha:]]+') as term, 0 as internal, '' as parentTerm from apidb.ESTATTRIBUTES where PROJECT_ID = '@PROJECT_ID@' union select distinct CASE WHEN att.stage != 'unknown' and att.DBEST_NAME not like '%'||att.stage||'%' THEN REPLACE(att.dbest_name, ',', ';') || ' (' || REPLACE(att.stage, ',', ';') || ')' ELSE REPLACE(att.dbest_name, ',', ';') END AS term, att.library_id as internal, REGEXP_SUBSTR(att.ORGANISM,'[[:alpha:]]+[[:space:]]+[[:alpha:]]+') as parentTerm from apidb.ESTATTRIBUTES att where att.PROJECT_ID = '@PROJECT_ID@') t, apidb.GENEATTRIBUTES ga where t.parentTerm = ga.species or t.term = ga.species

select distinct t.* from (select distinct REGEXP_SUBSTR(ORGANISM,'[[:alpha:]]+([[:space:]]+[[:alpha:]]+)+') as term, 0 as internal, '' as parentTerm from apidb.ESTATTRIBUTES where PROJECT_ID = '@PROJECT_ID@' union select distinct CASE WHEN att.stage != 'unknown' and att.DBEST_NAME not like '%'||att.stage||'%' THEN REPLACE(att.dbest_name, ',', ';') || ' (' || REPLACE(att.stage, ',', ';') || ')' ELSE REPLACE(att.dbest_name, ',', ';') END AS term, att.library_id as internal, REGEXP_SUBSTR(att.ORGANISM,'[[:alpha:]]+([[:space:]]+[[:alpha:]]+)+') as parentTerm from apidb.ESTATTRIBUTES att where att.PROJECT_ID = '@PROJECT_ID@') t, apidb.GENEATTRIBUTES ga where t.parentTerm = ga.species or t.term = ga.species
